summary:
The master Save Set (mostly vanilla)
45 saves of a mostly level 1 character charging throughout the main quest as a boxer.
Now with a smaller set
descriptionHtml:
The Problem
I am a serial character-creator. Iwant a new character every week, it seems, just to see how the new one would play. I rarely have the attention to play through the entire main quest yet I keep finding myself starting it over.



Incomplete (for me) solutions
I have played with Skyrim Unbound and Iloved it as an idea but then I keep wanting the main quest to be completed. I found Skyrim Ultimate Vanilla Saves but couldn't bring myself to play them as I was too unhappy with having 8 levels already (I like a mod named Character generation which requires me to have a character below level 3 to use it) and skills all in Destruction magic. What if I want to play as a magic-eschewing Barbarian? That doesn't fit. There was another save set titled Skip Past High Hrothgar Clean Save. This was a lower level so it looked great. But
this did not satisfy me because the character was already level 4.



My solution
So, I created a new character at thebeginning and played as a crazy Kajjit (Kajiiti...Kajjiiiit...however it is spelled) boxer named Clawra, whowears only gloves of the pugilist and some sort of clothes. With her we charged through the game rapidly. I accidentally got her to level
2 with speechcraft and lockpicking before I stopped doing those things. Everything obtained on her adventure was dropped off in the
chest in Breezehome as the quest progressed. I had to use a cheat code in Underdark to deal with those Dwemer monstrosities (though not
for dealing with any dragons). I have saved it in 45 different instances throughout so that one could choose the best time to join in.


Mods:
I did use some mods--Hearthfire,Dragonborn, Dawnguard, all of the unofficial patches, a Zelda music mod, a dark nights and dungeons mod, a colorful Skyrim mod and maybe one or two other cosmetic mods--the bare minimum for me. Judge for yourself if this matters for you.


To install:
1. Extract the save files to yourSkyrim save directory
C:\users\...\my documents\mygames\skyrim\save\ or whatever
2. Play Clawra or use race change tomake her someone new


To uninstall:
In Game:
In the save menu, select each save gamein sequence, pressing "x" and clicking "yes" or "Okay" or whatever it is.
Manually:
Open the directory where the games weresaved and sort them by name. Find the games numbered and named (which should all, then, be bunched together) and delete them all.
author: MaxColby
